data.scheme_name: Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Poicy (Textile & Leather Poicy), 2022 - Exemption From Land Conversion Fees - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 100% exemption on land conversion fees of agricultural land.
data.eligibility: Applicable to Micro, Small, Medium, Large, and Mega units in textile and leather sectors.
data.conditions:
1. Capacity Expansion/Modernization: To avail the benefits, there must be a capacity expansion/modernization of at least 25% of the capacity of the existing unit.
  2. False Declaration and Ineligibility: If any false declaration is given for the purpose of availing incentives or if incentives are availed for a unit that was not eligible, or any violation of the policy conditions occurs, the amount of incentive is liable to be recovered from the date of availing such benefit, along with the interest compounded annually at 18% per annum.
  3. Non-payment Recovery: In case of non-payment within the stipulated time, the State Government may recover such amounts, including interest, as arrears of land revenue.
  4. Minimum Operational Period: The unit availing subsidy under this policy shall remain in operation for a minimum period of 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives under the Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy (Textile & Leather Policy), with the exception of Force Majeure events.
  5. Force Majeure: Force Majeure refers to extraordinary events or circumstances beyond human control, such as an act of God (like natural calamities), war, strikes, riots, and crimes (but not including negligence, predictable/seasonal rain, or other events specifically excluded in the clause).
  6. Non-operation Penalty: If the unit becomes non-operational prior to 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives, all subsidies availed by the unit shall be recovered, along with interest compounded annually at 18% per annum.

data.context: Bihar Industrial Promotion Policy 2022 introduced to establish Bihar as a competitive and favored investment destination, achieve regional development, diversify exports, and augment livelihood opportunities for its people through resilient economic development.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to Improve and create a sustainable ecosystem for textile and leather sector Create entire value chain from ber to fashion Value addition to post production of khadi, silk, handloom, powerloom.
data.description: Scheme provides 100% exemption on land conversion fees of agricultural land.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through this Link: https://swc2.bihar.gov.in/investor/register
data.funding_mechanism: The eligible units would be required to submit online application for Stage I clearance to avail incentives.
data.additional_info:
Categorization of units under two Categories 

  • Category A -Weaving, Knitting, Apparel & Garment, Apparel & Garment Accessories, Hosiery, Leather & Leatherette Garments, Leather & Leatherette Accessories and Leather & Leatherette Footwear and all kinds of footwears. 
  • Category B-Spinning, Ginning, Textile Processing (Yarn, Printing), Man Made Fiber, Synthetic fiber,Polyester, Acrylic, Viscose, Rayon, Technical textile, Leather processing. 

Under this policy following units will not be eligible for any support under this policy: 

  • Units manufacturing narcotic drugs 
  • Units manufacturing alcoholic beverages 
  • Tobacco based industries 
  • Units manufacturing asbestos 

The above list will be called the negative list under the policy. 

  • The State Government shall have the right to decide whether a unit falls under the negative list and can modify the above list accordingly. 
  • As a general principle, any industry which impacts the environment adversely will be discouraged by the State Government for investment. 
  • Such industries will not be eligible for any incentive under this policy and be placed in the above mentioned negative list.
